images.caption: Figure 2:Cross-domain generalization on Camelyon16[20]and Camelyon17[21]: In-domain vs. Out-of-domain AUC and ACC comparisons.

Figure 3:Performance comparison across ALN metastasis and receptor status tasks on the BCNB[23]dataset. The default feature aggregator for the whole-slide images is the attention-based multiple instance learning method[32].

Figure 4:Visualization of a slice from the AC3/4[29]dataset and feature embeddings. (a) Raw EM image. (bâ€“d) Feature embeddings extracted from DINOv3-S/16 (b), DINOv3-B/16 (c), and DINOv3-L/16 (d) models, visualized by projecting the first three principal components into RGB space. (e) Corresponding affinity map derived from the raw image.

Figure 5:Visualization of the first three principal components derived from PCA on image patches. (a) CT images and (b) PET images are shown with their respective PCA visualizations, where each of the first three components is mapped to a color channel. (c) The resulting tumor region can be isolated by thresholding the first principal component to remove the background.
